intro: Millotia greevesii subsp. helmsii, commonly known as the Helms' millotia, is a rare and specialized plant species native to specific regions of California. It is a member of the Apiaceae family, characterized by its finely divided leaves and umbellate inflorescences. The subspecies is distinguished by its unique floral morphology and habitat preferences, often growing in rocky or sandy soils. It plays an important ecological role in its native environment, supporting local pollinators and contributing to biodiversity. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species requiring conservation efforts.
